title: Real-Life Context-Based Mathematics Learning Design for Indian Children

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of mathematics education theories and elementary mathematics curriculum
context.additional_context: Strengthening the capacity to design real-life mathematics learning that reflects the sociocultural backgrounds of low-income rural/urban children in India

learning_goals: Learners propose at least three math education design plans reflecting the socio-economic status (SES) of Indian children.
Learners develop at least ten math problems utilizing real-life contexts (market activities, traditional games, etc.).
Development of differentiated mathematics education strategies (at least two) considering learner background differences and evaluation plans
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
